Trial_Design.evidence: This large multicenter trial tested the safety and efficacy of neoadjuvant atezolizumab and surgery.

Participants.evidence: Patients with stage IB to select IIIB resectable non–small cell lung cancer and Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0/1 were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Patients received atezolizumab 1200 mg intravenously every 3 weeks for 2 cycles or less followed by resection.

Objective.evidence: This large multicenter trial tested the safety and efficacy of neoadjuvant atezolizumab and surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was major pathological response in patients without EGFR/ALK + alterations.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From April 2017 to February 2020, 181 patients were entered in the study.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In patients without EGFR/ALK alterations who underwent surgery, the major pathological response rate was 20% (29/143; 95% confidence interval, 14-28)

Result_Outcome.evidence: the major pathological response rate was 20% (29/143; 95% confidence interval, 14-28) and the pathological complete response rate was 6% (8/143; 95% confidence interval, 2-11).

Harms.evidence: There were no grade 4/5 treatment-related adverse events preoperatively.
